titles.title: Electricity Gouging Refund Act of 2003
Electricity Gouging Refund Act of 2003
A bill to amend the Federal Power Act to provide refunds for unjust and unreasonable charges on electric energy in the State of California.

action.text: Introduced in the Senate. Read the first time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under Read the First Time.

calendar.text: Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 625.

bill.summary:
Electricity Gouging Refund Act of 2003 - Amends the Federal Power Act to instruct the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission to order a refund (including interest) for that portion of charges on the transmission or sale of electric energy between June 1, 2000, and June 19, 2001, which the Commission finds unjust and unreasonable.
States that the total amount of such refunds shall be not less than $8.9 billion.
Directs the Commission to order the renegotiation of the long-term electricity contracts entered into between the energy companies and the State of California between January 1 and May 31, 2001.
